page.title: 07NATURE RESERVE, WESTWOODSIDE
page.content: The{Nature Reserves}in the Westwoodside area are{Bird's Wood}and {Haxey Turbary.}Habitats at{Bird's Wood include Birch Woodland, Gorse Heathland and Wetland. Numerous pools have resulted from quarry working and form suitable environments for most common species of wetland flora and fauna.{Bird's {Wood}is situated North West of the village of Westwoodside. {Haxey Turbary}is a block of birch woodland, situated near a small settlement of primitive houses in an area of acid peat and 'blow away' sand. Uncommon species located here include Long Eared Owl and Royal Fern. Ancient human remains have been found in the area. The turbary is a remaining portion of common land, the 'turfery' once used by parishioners for the digging of peat.
